name: Aggravating APIs
body:
### Purpose
We work with a lot of different API's on daily basis and we find that many of them could be improved, especially those from the information security space. It's as if API development was a second thought or a college student was contracted hastily to just get it done. With that said, the purpose of this website is to rate API's of useful services we depend on, in an effort to motivate change. In similar fashion to the [Two Factor Auth](https://twofactorauth.org/) list.

| API   | Conventions | Documentation | Notes |
| :---: |    :---:    |     :---:     | :---: |
| blah  | Inconsistent| Bad           | Link  |

### Contributing
Add an API to the list by submitting a pull request to the `gh-pages` branch on the [GitHub repo](https://github.com/open-nsm/aggravatingapis/tree/gh-pages).

### Authors and Contributors
@JonSchipp and [OpenNSM](http://www.open-nsm.net/) team.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? [Contact support](https://github.com/open-nsm/aggravatingapis/issues) and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
